benchmark_details.name: Word Embeddings Quantify 100 Years of Gender and Ethnic Stereotypes
benchmark_details.overview: The paper develops a framework to demonstrate how the temporal dynamics of word embeddings can be leveraged to quantify changes in stereotypes and attitudes toward women and ethnic minorities in the U.S. over the 20th and 21st centuries.
benchmark_details.data_type: Text data from historical documents and U.S. Census data
resources: Dataset of word embeddings trained on historical texts

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To quantify historical shifts in gender and ethnic stereotypes using word embeddings.
tasks: Analyze changes in language and stereotypes over time
Validate findings against external data such as census

data.source: Google News dataset, Google Books, and U.S. Census data
data.size: Datasets include 100 years of text data
data.annotation: Word vectors trained to represent words and their semantic relationships

methodology.calculation: Calculating the relative strength of association between groups and neutral words.
methodology.interpretation: The changes in embeddings reflect social shifts and trends in demographics.
methodology.validation: Validated against historical census data and crowd-sourced stereotype scores

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data provided under appropriate usage rights consistent with the sources.
